subject: RE: [junit] Object comparison using assertEquals
msgSnippet: ... You need to override the equals method in your classes. The default behavior just does: public boolean equals(Object obj) { return (this == obj); } Check
messageBody:
> On Tue, 2003-05-20 at 00:52, kartikdg wrote:
> > Hi,
> > I would like to deep compare 2 objects (expectedResult and
> > actualResult)
> > using JUnit.
> >
> > JUnit provides an interface called assertEquals(Object o1, Object o2)
> > which compares 2 obects by reference and does not perform a deep
> > comparison.

You need to override the equals method in your classes. The default behavior
just does:

public boolean equals(Object obj) {
return (this == obj);
}

Check the javadocs for more information.

Also, you might want to check out the Jakarta Apache commons project
(http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/). In the lang packages, they have a a
class EqualsBuilder, which helps implement this
(http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/lang/api/org/apache/commons/lang/builder/
EqualsBuilder.html)

Hope this helps
